European Commission dismisses interpreter over suspected espionage for Moscow
subhead: A translator present during a high-level, closed-door meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in late 2024 was caught taking notes, something that is strictly prohibited in this type of meeting.

title: Fire near Narbonne, France, brought under control but 'will go down in history'
subhead: A wildfire sparked in southern France on Monday was brought under control in the evening on Wednesday, July 9. More than 1,050 professional and volunteer firefighters, taken by surprise by its speed and intensity, were mobilized to contain its spread.
byline: By Maryline Baumard (Bages (southern France), special correspondent)

title: Paris inaugurates bike lane named after cyclist killed by motorist
subhead: The new 'Paul Varry' bike lane is the first in the capital to be given an official name and plaque, nine months after the young man's death.

title: 'Faced with Trump and an out-of-touch Democratic leadership, a left-wing surge is taking hold in the US'
subhead: On June 24, Zohran Mamdani, a member of the Democratic Party's left wing, won the party's nomination for mayor of New York City. While his path to victory will likely be difficult, academic Mathieu Bonzom argues that the rise of the American left is becoming increasingly credible.

byline: By Laura Motet and Clément Guillou

title: Channel crossings by migrants in small boats are on the rise
subhead: Since the beginning of the year, more than 20,000 men, women and children have managed to reach the United Kingdom – 7,000 more than during the same period in 2024. At least 15 people have died while attempting the crossing.
byline: By Julia Pascual (Boulogne-sur-Mer, Dunkirk and Loon-Plage special correspondent)

title: Is southern France ready for a surge in wildfires?
subhead: France is bracing for a risky summer. The national weather service has classified the Mediterranean arc at 'high' or 'very high' fire alert. While the country has learned lessons from major blazes in 2022, its firefighting aircraft fleet is aging.
byline: By Maryline Baumard and Léa Sanchez
